name: places/ChIJu3sx8YVZwokR-obk0PsSnz0
formattedAddress: 21 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 21 Prince St, New York, NY 10012-3553, USA

editorialSummary.text: Outpost of a local chain of consignment shops offering designer & vintage apparel & shoes for women.

originalText.text: I went there yesterday for the first time with a girlfriend and had an amazing experience. The selection of pieces was amazing and the staff, especially Squirrel, were so welcoming, friendly and kind. We stayed another 40 minutes just chatting with the staff. I can’t understand the experiences others have alleged to have had there in other reviews. I will be returning and looking forward to it. Thank you for a wonderful time, Squirrel!

originalText.text:
Went to the Union Sq location for 10yrs but w its closure went to Soho. NEVER going back: meh selection (generally out of style, light colors have make up stain on them) and HORRIBLE staff.

The older white women here are very haughty. I was using the dressing room offered by a younger lady and an older staff tried to kick me out by just taking out my selection. Listen, it’s fine to hurry me along but communication would have been mature. Just a little “Are you done?” Then she started talking about how women don’t “just go in and out” with another staff… I can hear you… Jesus Christ, I almost walked out then and there but swallowed my self respect in case there’s a jewel missing. NOPE. No diamond in the rough here. Don’t waste your time.

originalText.text: Echoing the sentiment of past reviewers, the staff here is extremely rude and disrespectful. I would not recommend coming here. I brought my aunt who was visiting and she made the mistake of calling the shop a “thrift store” as we walked in. The employees proceeded to project repeated  passive aggressive side comments to each other about my aunt using the word “thrift” the entirety of our time there. It made for a very unpleasant and uncomfortable shopping experience. For those looking for better selection, better prices, and kinder staff I recommend checking out Seven Wonders or Arcade in BK

originalText.text:
This place has some great pieces. The unfortunate thing is I left empty-handed never to return because of how I and the other shoppers were treated. While in the fitting room, I overheard the blonde woman working (possibly the manager?) body-shaming everyone who came in commenting about their “arm fat” and making fun of some foreign people’s name.

Then when I asked to try some pieces on they said I could just go into a fitting room, not asking me how many items I had. I tried on pieces and found one item I planned to buy. Then when I left the fitting room, the woman was appalled that I had about 7 pieces in my room. She exclaimed “Oh my God you’re not supposed to have more than 5 pieces in here!”  She then proceeded to snatch items from my room and mutter “Oh shit” to me under her breath. So I told her I wouldn’t be buying the item I was interested in and she of course snatched that from me while rolling her eyes. This person clearly gets off on making others feel bad.

If you like verbal abuse, by all means give this place a try. If not, try somewhere else.

originalText.text:
Incredibly rude staff. They snatch items right off your hands, constantly bump and cut in front of you to put items back while you try to browse instead of waiting. Mirrors are quite dirty. Cramped small space with no customer limit. A lot of pieces with stains and massive pilling issues that could easily be resolved by spot using oxyclean and a fabric shaver. More of an overpriced thrift store than a consignment shop.

The workers make unpleasant comments and they do not honor their sale prices. Left without buying what I wanted out of principle. If you want to treat people poorly then I’d rather not shop here.
